intro: Ecbolium heterantherum, commonly known as the clustered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Ecbolium heterantherum is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
